item.title: What I've Learned from Maintaining a Web App in Production for Over a Year
item.description:
It has been more than a year now since I originally deployed my COVID-19 Tracker to a live environment. In the time that it has been in production, I have learned a whole lot, both in terms of maintaining an app in production, and in watching the progression of the pandemic.

At the very least, I have definitely come to truly appreciate how essential having something deployed to a live environment is to the learning process of being a good developer. To summarize, here are some of the most important things I’ve learned from this experience.

item.title: One Year On
item.description:
After recently going over some of my earliest blog posts, it dawned on me that I have been maintaining this blog for a whole year now. This realization inspired me to reflect on how and where the blog started, what’s happened since, as well as what the future might entail.

In the Beginning….

The blog was without form. Well, not quite. When this blog started out, it was rather primitive. I was using Jekyll, as I had not yet done research into other static site generators, and deploying to GitHub Pages without a custom domain.
